required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Antenatal Support for Iron Deficiency Anemia
clinical_study.official_title: Early Antenatal Support for Iron Deficiency Anemia: A Randomized Controlled Trial of Early Initiation of Intravenous Versus Oral Iron Therapy for Treatment of Iron Deficiency Anemia in Pregnancy

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, controlled multi-site trial of iron therapy in pregnancy. The purpose of this research is to see if second trimester initiation of intravenous (IV) iron therapy is better than oral iron therapy for treatment of anemia in pregnancy by improving blood count, quality of life and reducing side effects.

detailed_description.textblock: Pregnant singletons diagnosed with iron deficiency anemia will be enrolled between 14-24 weeks and will be randomized 1:1 to either a course of ferumoxytol (510mg x 2 doses 3-8 days apart) or oral iron (325mg) twice daily.

primary_outcome.description: Change in hemoglboin at day 90 following treatment initiation

secondary_outcome.description: Percent of participants in each group with Hb>=11.0 at day 90
Percent of participants in each group with Hb>=11.0 at delivery
Percent of participants in each group requiring additional therapy for iron deficiency anemia after 28 weeks
adherence to assigned group. Measured by what % of IV infusions completed of the two required in IV iron group, and for oral iron group, what %pills taken/prescribed based on pill counts
Incidence of transfusion after delivery/post partum

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal outcomes: cord blood iron indices
Neonatal outcomes gestational age of delivery (weeks)

arm_group.description: 510mg ferumoxytol intravenous infusion for two doses total; second dose 3-8 days after first dose.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Singleton gestation
- Gestational age <24 weeks
- Baseline Hb â‰¥9.0 and <11.0 with evidence of iron deficiency anemia
Iron deficiency anemia diagnosed (at any point in patient history) by:
- Hb<11.0
- Ferritin<30 and/or total iron saturation <20
Exclusion Criteria:
- Sickle cell Disease (NOT sickle cell trait)
- Evidence of acute anemia requiring transfusion or IV iron therapy
- Major congenital or chromosomal anomaly
- Previous use of IV iron in this pregnancy
- Severe cardiac, renal, or liver disease
- Autoimmune disease (ie Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
- Allergy or contraindication to either study drug
- History of medication allergy, reaction to IV infusion, or reaction to Feraheme or other IV iron products

patient_data.ipd_description: After completion of planned primary and secondary analysis, IPD data may be available on request with completion of appropriate data sharing agreements
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: 1 year after publication of study results
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: After completion of planned primary and secondary analysis, IPD data may be available on request with completion of appropriate data sharing agreements
